translated: Laá¹…kÃ¢vatÄra SÅ«tra, Fascicle 10
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Bodhiruci of the Yuanwei Dynasty
Relying on the Buddhas' upholding, the power of vows is pure;
Receiving the position and samÄdhi, merit and the ten grounds.
Space and rabbit horns, and the daughter of a stone man;
Distinguishing dharmas is like this, non-existent yet speaking of names.
The perfuming of causes and seeds in the world, neither existent nor non-existent;
Able to see and attain liberation, understanding the non-self of dharmas.
The name of the real essence, the other essence arises from causes;
I say this is accomplishment, the various sÅ«tras always speak of this.
Words, phrases, names, and so forth, in the supreme dharma of names;
Foolish people discriminate, like an elephant sinking in deep mud.
The celestial vehicle, the BrahmÄ vehicle, and the Å›rÄvaka vehicle;
The TathÄgata and pratyekabuddhas, I say this vehicle is like that.
The vehicles are inexhaustible, the mind arises like this;
The mind turns and ceases, there is no vehicle or one who rides the vehicle.
Mind, discrimination, and consciousness, intention, and mental consciousness;
Ä€laya, three existences, contemplation, and mind have different names.
Life, warmth, and consciousness, Älaya, and the faculty of life;
Intention, and mental consciousness, these are different names for discrimination.
The mind abides in the body, the intention always perceives phenomena;
Consciousness is the realm of one's own mind, together with consciousness, discrimination.
I say craving is the mother, ignorance is the father;
Consciousness perceives various realms, therefore it is called the Buddha.
The afflictions are enemies, the various combinations are the aggregates;
Without a continuous essence, cutting them off is called uninterrupted.
The two kinds of selflessness and afflictions, as well as the two kinds of selflessness;
The inconceivable transformation, without the name of birth and death is Buddha.
The essence of the mind and associated dharmas, the self and dharmas are the inner body;
If one can see in this way, they do not follow false thoughts.
In reality, there are no dharmas, as foolishly discriminated;
Relying on false and non-existent dharmas, how can one attain liberation?
The bondage of arising and ceasing, seeing conditioned dharmas;
Increasing the two views, not losing the dharma of causes and conditions.
Banana trees, dreams, illusions, and so forth, this is how the world is;
There is only one true dharma, nirvana, apart from the mental consciousness.
There is greed, anger, and also delusion, and there are people without them;
From craving, the aggregates are born, the existence of the aggregates is also like a dream.
What kind of night does one realize the Dharma, what kind of night does one enter extinction,
Between these two, I do not speak a single word.
I rely on this to speak: the inner body realizes the Dharma;
That Buddha and my body have no supreme Dharma to speak.
There truly is a divine self, separate from the characteristics of the five aggregates;
The essence of the aggregates truly exists, but there is no self within those aggregates.
Each sees discrimination, following afflictions and propensities;
Obtaining one's own mind in the world, leaving suffering and attaining liberation.
All causes and conditions, the world arises in this way;
These four dharmas correspond, they do not abide in my teaching.
Non-existent dharmas are not born, apart from existence and non-existence they are not born;
How do the foolish discriminate, from causes and conditions?
The four propositions of existence and non-existence are left behind, if one can see the world;
At that time, the mind and consciousness turn, and one attains the Dharma of no-self.
All dharmas are originally unborn, therefore they arise from causes and conditions;
The conditions are precisely the fruits, and existence arises within the fruits.
Two kinds arise within the fruits, and two should exist within the fruits;
But there is no fruit within the two, and no substance is seen within the fruits.
Apart from the observer and the observable, if one sees conditioned phenomena;
Apart from the mind, it is only the mind, therefore I say it is only mind.
The real substance and form of the measure, apart from the real substance of conditions;
The ultimate, supreme purity, I say the measure is like this.
Just as the provisional name is for the self, there is no real dharma to be seen;
In the same way, the aggregates and the essence of the aggregates, are provisional names, not real.
There are four kinds of equality, characteristics, causes, and arising;
Non-self is also equal, the four dharmas of the practitioner.
Transcending all views, discrimination, and the discriminable,
Because of non-seeing and non-arising, therefore I speak of mind-only.
No dharma and not non-existent, apart from the substance of existence and non-existence;
Suchness is apart from the mind, therefore I speak of mind-only.
Suchness, emptiness, the ultimate truth, nirvana, and the dharma realm;
The mind-born body and mind, therefore I speak of mind-only.
Distinguishing the perfuming of dependence, various arising and various;
Sentient beings' minds see externally, therefore I speak of mind-only.
The visible has no external objects, seeing the mind's various views;
The body, livelihood, and support, therefore I speak of mind-only.ğŸ”½The knowledge of extinction of the Å›rÄvakas, the birth of all buddhas and tathÄgatas;
All pratyekabuddhas, born without combination.
No external various forms, one's own mind sees external dharmas;
Awakening to one's own mind, the foolish discriminate conditioned phenomena.
Fools do not know the external, the various views of their own minds;
Parables are used to stop fools from clinging to the four kinds of dharmas.
No cause, no discrimination, parables, the five kinds of treatises;
The essence and form of one's own mind, one who knows this is wise.
Relying on discrimination and the discriminated, this is the characteristic of discrimination;
Relying on discrimination, discrimination arises in the present.
Each individual combination is a kind of seed cause;
The two guest dharmas are two, therefore the human mind does not arise.
The discriminating mind and mental factors abide in the two realms;
Arising in the present of all dharmas, their essence is false.
Relying on the present combination of causes, therefore there are twelve sense fields;
Relying on causes and observing combination, I do not call this dharma.
Like seeing a reflection in a mirror, the eye sees a hair wheel;
In this way, the deluded mind of the foolish person sees
In common with discrimination, discrimination arises;
Like the discrimination of non-Buddhists, there is no such external characteristic.
Like a person who does not recognize a rope, taking it to be a snake;
Not understanding the meaning of one's own mind, one discriminates external dharmas.
And riding on the essence of the vehicle, apart from one, two, and the middle;
Discriminating the vehicle, this is the fault of one's own mind.
Relying on what dharma, what essence, discrimination cannot see;
One cannot say that it does not exist, the essence of dharmas is like this.
Relying on existence, one says nonexistence; relying on nonexistence, one says existence;
Therefore, one cannot say it does not exist, nor can one say it exists.
It is discrimination discriminating, this is not the essence of that dharma;
How can one see the absence of essence and give rise to discrimination?
The substance of form is not the formless body, like a vase or cloth, etc.;
The visible is a non-existent dharma, how can there be discrimination?
If discrimination is delusion, conditioned dharmas are beginningless;
What dharma deludes sentient beings?
The Sage speaks for me.
All dharmas are without a dharma-body, yet it is said to be only mind;
Not seeing one's own mind, one gives rise to discrimination.
If discrimination is non-existent, like the discrimination of a fool,
That dharma has no different body, yet wisdom cannot perceive it.
If the Sage has that dharma, it is not the deluded discrimination of an ordinary person;
If the Sage falsely has it, there is no difference between the Sage and a fool.
The Sage is without confusion, having attained the purity of mind;
The fool has no faith, and thus discriminates discriminatively.
Like a mother for her children, the sky brings fruit;
You take the fruit, don't cry, child, take all kinds of fruit.
I distinguish various fruits for sentient beings,
Causing them to crave various teachings, leaving behind the factions of existence and non-existence.
If originally there is no essence of dharmas, not from causes, not from causes,
Originally unborn, now born, also without its own body.
Without a body, also not born, apart from causes and conditions, no place;
The essence of dharmas of birth and cessation, apart from causes and conditions, no place.
Briefly observing thus, existence and non-existence are not elsewhere;
From causes and conditions arise dharmas, the wise should not discriminate.
Speaking of one essence and two essences, the foolish and ignorant speak of them;
The world is like an illusion and dream, not arising from causes and conditions.
Relying on the realm of language, the unsurpassed Dharma of the Great Vehicle;
I rely on the definitive meaning to speak, but the foolish and ignorant are unaware.
ÅšrÄvakas and non-Buddhists, relying on jealousy, expound the Dharma;
In meaning, they are not in accord, expounding based on false awakening.
Characteristics, essence, and form, these are the four kinds of dharmas;
Contemplating such dharmas, therefore giving rise to discrimination.
Discriminating one, two, and many, they are bound by the Brahma Heaven;
The sun, moon, and various gods, this view is not my child.
The sage sees the true Dharma, practicing in accordance with reality;
Able to transform false appearances, also free from going and coming.
This is the seal of liberation, I teach the Buddha's disciples;
Free from existence and non-existence, also free from the characteristics of going and coming.
Transforming the various colored consciousnesses, if extinguishing all karmic activity;
Should not be permanent or impermanent, there is no worldly arising dharma.
At the time of transformation, if extinguished, form is separated from that place;
Separated from faults, karma abides in the Älaya.
Form is the essence of cessation, consciousness also exists in this way;
Form and consciousness are combined, yet karma is not lost.
If combined with that, sentient beings lose all karma;
If cessation combines with karma, there is neither bondage nor nirvÄá¹‡a.
If combined with that cessation, birth occurs in the world;
Form is also combined, but should not have distinctions.
There are distinctions and also no distinctions, but this is just the mind's discrimination;
All dharmas have no essence of cessation, free from the factions of existence and nonexistence.
Provisional names and conditioned dharmas mutually have no distinctions;
Just as impermanence in form mutually produces all dharmas.
Free from the characteristics of this and that, discrimination cannot be known;
How can existence and nonexistence be established?
Just like impermanence in form.
If one sees well and discriminates, then one does not give rise to other-power;
Seeing the dharmas of other-power, one also does not give rise to discrimination.
If one extinguishes discrimination, then one extinguishes my dharmas;
In my dharmas, one also slanders existence and nonexistence.
In what time period is there this person who slanders the Dharma?
This extinguishes my Dharma wheel, and one cannot speak with them.
The wise do not speak with them, and do not share the Dharma with bhiká¹£us;
Having already extinguished discrimination, false views are separated from existence and nonexistence.
Seeing like a hair wheel, an illusion, like a dream gandharva;
Also seeing like a mirage, sometimes seeing existence and nonexistence.
That person does not realize the Buddha, if there is a person who subsumes them;
That person falls into the two extremes, and also destroys other people.
If one knows the tranquil Dharma, this is a true practitioner;
Separated from existence and nonexistence, one should embrace that person.
Just as there are places where gold, silver, and various precious treasures can be obtained,
Without karma creating various things, sentient beings enjoy and use them.
The true nature of sentient beings is not due to the existence of karma;
Because it is not seen, there is no karma, and it is also not produced by the performance of karma.
The nature of dharmas is non-existent, as distinguished by the sages;
Yet there are dharmas, as distinguished by the ignorant.
If dharmas are not like this, as distinguished by the ignorant,
There are no dharmas at all, and sentient beings are also not defiled.
Dharmas exist based on the mind, and afflictions are also like this;
The various worlds of birth and death follow the various faculties.
Ignorance and craving come together and give rise to various bodies;
Other people always have no dharmas, as distinguished by the ignorant.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
If dharmas and persons are not produced, the practitioner does not see the root;
If all dharmas are nonexistent, they can serve as causes for the world.
The foolish person would be separated from action and should naturally attain liberation;
The foolish and the sages would be no different. How could existence and nonexistence be established?
The sage has no essence of dharmas, but cultivates the three liberations;
The five aggregates and person-dharmas have both the same and different characteristics.
The various causes and conditions and faculties, I explain for the Å›rÄvakas;
Without causes, only the mind, the wondrous matter and various stages.
The purity of the true suchness of the inner body, I explain for the Buddha's disciples;
In the future there will be those who slander my Dharma wheel.
Wearing the kasaya robe, they will speak of the various dharmas of existence and nonexistence;
Dharmas without causes and conditions exist, this is the realm of the sages.
Discerning the essence of dharmas that do not exist, the falsely awakened one discriminates;
In the future, there will be people who eat chaff and are foolish and ignorant.
Without cause, they have wrong views and destroy worldly people;
The world arises from the subtle particles, but the subtle particles have no cause.
The nine kinds of substances are permanent, as the wrong views say;
From substance, substance arises; from merit, merit arises.
This dharma is different from dharma; this is the distinction of substance and essence;
If it originally arises without beginning, the world should have a beginning.
I say that in the world, there is no beginning;
The sentient beings in the three realms have no beginning and no origin.
Dogs, camels, and donkeys have no horns, but they must be born without doubt;
The eyes originally have no beginning, and form and consciousness are also like this.
Cloth, hats, white cloth, and so on should be born from clay lumps;
There is no pot in the cloth, and there is no cloth in the straw.
Why does the cause not produce in one thing?
Life is the same as the body, this is originally beginningless.
This is what others say about the Dharma, I say that all dharmas are different;
I accept the Dharma of dependent origination, then I refute the Dharma of others.
Refuting those with wrong views, later I speak of my own Dharma;
Therefore, I accept the Dharma of non-Buddhists, then I speak the true Dharma.
Fearing that disciples will be confused, establishing existence and non-existence;
Born into the world from the supreme person, Kapila's evil intentions.
For the disciples, he speaks of the transformation of all merits;
Not real, not unreal, not from conditions, not conditions.
Because there are no causes and conditions, unreal dharmas do not arise;
Free from existence and non-existence, free from causes and also free from conditions.
Free from the dharma of arising and ceasing, one's own dharma is free from what can be seen;
The world is like an illusion or dream, apart from the dharmas of causes and conditions.
Those who establish the view of causes and conditions, therefore give rise to discrimination;
Like animals lusting after water, or the gandharvas' hair-wheel.
Apart from existence and non-existence, apart from causes and conditions;
Seeing the three existences without a cause, such is the pure mind's view.
What kind of person is without affairs?
There is only the inner mind;
Far removed from mental affairs, one cannot speak of mind-only.
If one observes external affairs, sentient beings give rise to the mind;
How can the mind be without a cause?
One cannot speak of mind-only.
Suchness exists only in the mind, what person lacks the holy Dharma?
Existence and non-existence, they do not understand my Dharma.
The dharma of grasper and the dharma of the graspable, if the mind arises like this;
This is the worldly mind, one should not speak of mind-only.
The body, resources, and dwelling place are like dreams;
There should be two kinds of mind, but the mind has no dual characteristics.
Just as a knife cannot cut itself, and a finger cannot point at itself;
Just as the mind cannot see itself, the matter is also like this.
Not other, not dependent origination, discriminating discriminating phenomena;
The five dharmas and two minds are quiescent, without such things.
The able to give rise, the giving rise, and the two kinds of dharma characteristics;
My mind is without the able to give rise, speaking of dharmas without self-characteristics.
Various forms and appearances, if giving rise to discrimination;
Space, rabbit horns, and so forth, their substance should not give rise.
If there are various dharma characteristics, there should be external phenomena;
Because there is no external discrimination, apart from the mind there are no dharmas.
In the beginningless world, there are no external dharmas;
Using the cause of the non-arising of mind, one sees external objects.
If there is no cause for growth, rabbit horns should also grow;
Since there is no cause for growth, how can discrimination arise?
Just as the present has no existence, so too does the past have no existence;
How can the mind give rise to the combination of non-substance and substance?
Suchness, emptiness, the ultimate truth, nirvana, and the dharma realm;
All dharmas arise, this is the supreme truth.
The ignorant fall into existence and non-existence, discriminating causes and conditions;
Without a cause, originally unborn, they do not know the three realms of existence.
The mind sees the visible, with different views due to beginningless causes;
Without a beginning, there are also no dharmas, how can one see different beings?
If there is no substance that can give rise to, the poor should have much wealth;
How can non-substance arise?
The Sage speaks for me.
All of these are without mind, yet not without dharmas;
Gandharvas, dreams, and illusions - dharmas exist without causes.
Without arising, without essence or characteristics, empty dharmas, please explain for me;
Apart from the combined dharmas, this is not seeing any dharmas.
At that time, I explain the characteristic of the non-existent dharma of empty non-arising;
Dreams, floating hairs, illusions, gandharvas, and water.
Without causes, there is seeing - worldly dharmas are also like this;
Thus, the combination is one, apart from the visible, there is no.
Not the view of various non-Buddhists, the combination is not like this;
Subduing the reliance on no causes, accomplishing non-arising.
If one can accomplish non-arising, my Dharma wheel will not perish;
Explaining the characteristic of no causes, non-Buddhists give rise to fear.
How is it? For whom?
Where do all dharmas come from?
Where does the dharma arise?
The dharma arises without a cause.
Arising from no cause, there are no two causes;
If the wise one sees this, then wrong views are overturned.
It is said that the arising of all dharmas is non-arising and non-existent;
In order to contemplate the various causes and conditions, then wrong views are overturned.
Are there dharmas with names, or are there no dharmas with no names?
Yet dharmas do not arise without causes, nor do they depend on causes and conditions.
Names do not depend on dharmas, yet names are not without substance;
The Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and non-Buddhists are not the realm [of this truth];
The bodhisattvas dwelling on the seventh ground, for them there are no characteristics of arising.
The turning of the dharma of causes and conditions, therefore, negates the meaning of causes;
Only speaking of dependence on the mind, therefore I speak of non-arising.
The arising of dharmas without a cause, apart from discrimination and discrimination;
Therefore I speak of non-arising.ğŸ”½The mind is separated from the visible,
And also separated from the two bodies;ğŸ”½Transcending the basis of the Dharma,
Therefore I speak of non-arising.ğŸ”½Not losing the essence of external dharmas,
And also not grasping the internal mind,ğŸ”½Separating from all wrong views,
This is the characteristic of non-arising.ğŸ”½Thus emptiness and signlessness,
All should be observed,ğŸ”½Not arising from the emptiness of emptiness,
The originally unborn is emptiness.ğŸ”½The combination of causes and conditions,
Arising and cessation,ğŸ”½Separating from the combined dharmas,
Non-arising and non-cessation,ğŸ”½If separated from the combined dharmas,
There is no real essence of dharmas.ğŸ”½The same essence and different essences,
Like the distinctions made by non-Buddhists;ğŸ”½Existence and non-existence do not give rise to dharmas,ğŸ”½The real does not arise or not arise.ğŸ”½Separating from all causes and conditions,
Arising and non-arising;
It is only in names that they are mutually bound together.
The body of the arising is completely non-existent, bound by the causes of distinctions;
Apart from the arising and non-arising, this is apart from all non-Buddhists.
I say it is only the binding, but ordinary beings do not know;
And the body of the arising dharma, apart from the binding, there is no other.
That person has no cause to speak, destroying and breaking all bindings.
Just as a lamp illuminates all things, the binding should also be able to illuminate;
If there is another dharma apart from the body of the hook and chain,
Without a body, it also does not arise, its self-nature is like empty space;
Apart from the dharma of the hook and chain, the foolish have different discriminations.
This is the non-arising of difference, the dharma attained by the sages;
That dharma arises and does not arise, non-arising is non-arising.
If one sees all worlds, it is just the hook and chain of conditions;
Who in the world is the hook and chain? At that time, the mind attains concentration.
Ignorance, craving, karma, and so forth, are the internal hook and chain dharmas.
The banner, clay ball, wheel, and so forth, are external dharmas of the four great elements.
Relying on the substance of other dharmas, this arises from causes and conditions.
Not only the substance of the hook and chain, does not abide in the scriptures.
If the dharma that can be produced does not exist, what dharma does wisdom take as its cause?
Those dharmas are mutually produced, they are not the causes and conditions.
Heat, moisture, movement, and solidity, the foolish discriminate the dharmas;
This hook and chain has no dharma, therefore it has no substantial characteristics.
Just as a physician, based on the illness, speaks of the differences in treating the illness;
But the treatise has no differences, based on the illness there are differences.
I, based on the bodies of sentient beings, speak of the defilements and turbidity,
Knowing the faculties and powers, I speak for the sake of the foolish dharma.
The distinctions in the roots of afflictions, my teaching is without distinction,
I have only one vehicle, the eightfold noble path of coolness.
A pot, a cloth, a crown, and horns, the horns of a rabbit have no cause;
Without a cause, they arise in dependence on that, but there is no dharma of that cause;
But that is a non-existent dharma, you cannot grasp non-existence.
Because of relying on a cause, non-existence is not appropriate,
The dharma of existence in relation to non-existence, this is a dharma of mutual dependence.
If relying on a small existent dharma, one sees a small existent dharma;
Without a cause, seeing a small dharma, the small dharma is without a cause.
If that relies on another dharma, the two see each other mutually;
In this way, there is the fault of infinite regress, the small also has no essence of smallness.
Relying on form, wood, and so forth, like an illusory dharma that can be seen;
In this way, relying on an object, a person sees various kinds.
The magician is not form, etc., nor is he wood or stone;
The foolish see the illusory body as real, relying on the illusory body.
Relying on real things, if one sees a small thing;
When seeing, there are no two dharmas, how can one see a small thing?
Distinguishing the nondiscriminating, but not without discrimination;
If there is no dharma to discriminate, there is no bondage and no liberation.
Because there is no dharma to discriminate, therefore discrimination does not arise;
If discrimination does not arise, one cannot speak of mind-only.
Various distinctions in mind, there is no real dharma among dharmas;
Because there is no real dharma, there is no liberation in the world.
There are no external objects to be seen, foolishly falsely discriminated;
Like reflections appearing in the mind, the mind is deluded and submerged due to perfuming.
All dharmas are unborn, appearing as if born but not existent;
All of this is only mind, free from all conceptualization.
Fools speak of dharmas arising from causes, not the wise;
The real essence is apart from the mind, the sage's mind is pure.
SÄá¹ƒkhya, VaiÅ›eá¹£ika, naked brÄhmans,
And ÄªÅ›vara, without reality, fall into wrong views.
'Without essence and also unborn, like empty illusions without defilements;
For what do the buddhas speak?
For what kind of person do the buddhas speak?'
The person of pure practice, free from wrong views and conceptual thoughts,
The buddhas speak the Dharma as it is, and I speak in the same way.
'If everything is only mind, where does the world abide?
What Dharma do coming and going rely on?
How is it seen in the earth?'
Like a bird in the sky, relying on the wind to go,
Not abiding, not observing, it goes on the ground.
Thus, all sentient beings depend on the wind of discrimination to move;
Coming and going in their own minds, like a bird flying in the sky.
The Buddha says that seeing the body, resources, and environment is like this;
How is it that what is seen is only the mind?
Please explain this to me.
The body, resources, and environment that are seen arise from the perfuming of habitual tendencies;
They do not arise for one who practices, but arise from discrimination in what is seen.
The essence of the discriminated objects arises from the mind depending on objects;
Knowing that what is seen is the mind, one no longer gives rise to discrimination.
If one can see discrimination, apart from the cognizer and the cognized,
The name and the named are not combined; this is said to be conditioned dharmas.
This is only what can be cognized, the name and the named are not separate;
Apart from the knower and the known, this is said to be conditioned dharmas.
This is only what can be cognized, the name and the named are not apart within;
If one is different from the cognizer, one cannot cognize oneself or others.
The five dharmas, the fundamental true dharmas, and the eight kinds of consciousness;
The two kinds of no-self dharmas encompass the Great Vehicle.
If one sees the knowable and the quiescent view of the world,
The name in the name is discriminated, and then it is not born again.
Making distinctions in names and forms, seeing them not born again;
Not seeing one's own mind, therefore discrimination arises.
'The four skandhas are without characteristics, and they are without the dharma of number;
How is it that form has many kinds, with the four elements having different characteristics?
Abandoning the dharma of characteristics, without the great and the great;
If there are different characteristics of form, why does the skandha not arise?'
If one sees such characteristics, one does not see the skandhas and sense bases;
Relying on the sense faculties and consciousness, the eight kinds of consciousness arise.
The characteristics are of three kinds, but quiescence and extinction are not like this;
The Älaya consciousness, the self, the mine, and the cognition,
Because of grasping at the two dharmas, knowing those dharmas is extinguished.
'Apart from these dharmas, if one sees non-separation,
The world is only mind - may the World-Honored One explain it to me.'
No longer discriminating the two, the self and the mine,
Non-increasing discrimination, also no mental consciousness cause.
'Apart from causes and conditions, not a thing, not arising;
Discrimination is just mind - may the World-Honored One explain it to me.'
Apart from all causes and conditions, apart from the seer and the seen,
Seeing one's own mind's various, seen false discriminations.
Not knowing one's own mind's seeing, not realizing the meaning of different minds,
No seeing, wrong views are established.
If one does not see in wisdom,
Why is it not existent?
The mind of that person grasps existence, discriminating non-existence and existence, therefore the mind of existence does not arise;
Not knowing it is only the mind's perception, therefore discrimination arises.
Non-discrimination and discrimination are extinguished, having no cause;
Preventing the four kinds of factions.
If dharmas have a cause, this is a different name and characteristic, that person's creation is not accomplished;
They should be born differently from themselves, otherwise they should be born from a cause.
The conditions should be combined, preventing the cause from producing dharmas,
I prevent the fault of permanence.
If the conditions are impermanent, they are not produced and not extinguished, the ignorant see impermanence;
The characteristic of extinction is a dharma without a dharma, not seeing the cause being produced.
Therefore impermanence produces existence, why do people not see it?
I take in and accept sentient beings, relying on precepts to subdue them;
With wisdom, I eliminate wrong views, relying on liberation to increase [their understanding].
All worldly conventions, the false speech of non-Buddhists,
Rely on cause and effect and wrong views, unable to establish their own teachings;
They only establish their own teachings, apart from causes, conditions, and effects.
They say that the assembly of disciples is apart from worldly conventions;
Only the mind can be seen, but the mind does not see the two kinds.
Apart from the graspable and the grasper, also apart from annihilation and permanence;
There is only the movement of the mind, all of which are worldly conventions.
No longer giving rise to transformation and birth, seeing the world as one's own mind;
The coming is the arising of phenomena, the going is the cessation of phenomena.
Truly understanding coming and going, no longer giving rise to discrimination;
Permanence and impermanence, as well as creation, also not creating this and that.
All of these are worldly dharmas;

The transformation of the fruition of karma, consciousness and mental consciousness;
The mind arises from the fundamental consciousness, and consciousness arises from the mind.
All consciousnesses arise from the fundamental, able to give rise to waves like the ocean;
All arise from perfumed causes, and arise in accordance with conditions.
The differences in memory are like a chain, binding the mind to grasp at objects;
Resembling the characteristics of form, the mind, eye, and other consciousnesses arise.
Bound by errors since beginningless time, grasping at objects born from perfuming;
Seeing external mind and phenomena, refuting the views of non-Buddhists.
Dependent on that, further arising, and dependent on that observation arising;
Therefore, wrong views arise, as well as worldly birth and death.
All phenomena are like dreams and illusions, like a city of gandharvas;
